sentence.text: Study of RetGC1 regulation in vitro and its association with fluorescently tagged positive regulation of guanylate cyclase activity in transfected cells showed that R822P substitution in the cyclase dimerization domain causing congenital early onset blindness disrupted RetGC1 ability to bind positive regulation of guanylate cyclase activity but did not eliminate its affinity for another photoreceptor-specific protein, retinal degeneration 3 (RD3).

entity.text: positive regulation of guanylate cyclase activity
